data.name: Turtwig
data.flavorText: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

data.name: Treecko
data.flavorText: Small hooks on the bottom of its feet catch on walls and ceilings. That is how it can hang from above.

data.name: Tepig
data.flavorText: It blows fire through its nose. When it catches a cold, the fire becomes pitch-black smoke instead.

data.name: Totodile
data.flavorText: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.

data.name: Oshawott
data.flavorText: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

data.name: Chikorita
data.flavorText: It uses the leaf on its head to determine the temperature and humidity. It loves to sunbathe.

data.name: Chespin
data.flavorText: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

data.name: Torchic
data.flavorText: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

data.name: Piplup
data.flavorText: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

data.name: Popplio
data.flavorText: This Pokémon snorts body fluids from its nose, blowing balloons to smash into its foes. It's famous for being a hard worker.

data.name: Bulbasaur
data.flavorText: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this Pokémon.

data.name: Grookey
data.flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

data.name: Charmander
data.flavorText: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

data.name: Chimchar
data.flavorText: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

data.name: Fennekin
data.flavorText: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Litten
data.flavorText: While grooming itself, it builds up fur inside its stomach. It sets the fur alight and spews fiery attacks, which change based on how it coughs.

data.name: Squirtle
data.flavorText: It shelters itself in its shell, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

data.name: Snivy
data.flavorText: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

data.name: Rowlet
data.flavorText: This wary Pokémon uses photosynthesis to store up energy during the day, while becoming active at night.

data.name: Cyndaquil
data.flavorText: It has a timid nature. If it is startled, the flames on its back burn more vigorously.

data.name: Mudkip
data.flavorText: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

data.name: Froakie
data.flavorText: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Its nature is to store up electricity. Forests where nests of Pikachu live are dangerous, since the trees are so often struck by lightning.
